items.sentence: Tom and Mary got married after they graduated college.
It wouldn\'t be the first time that that has happened.
Tom told me that he thought I should lose some weight.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was a good cook.
Tom told me that he thought this book was interesting.
Tom bought some of the potatoes that Mary was selling.
Tom knows he shouldn\'t be singing this late at night.
Tom knows something about Mary that he won\'t tell us.
Tom is better at speaking French than you think he is.
Tom says he doesn\'t have time to take French lessons.
Thanks for taking the time to answer all my questions.
Tom didn\'t know how many of his students needed help.
Tom didn\'t know that Mary was going to be here today.
Tom didn\'t know where he was when he finally woke up.
You don\'t seem to be as organized as Tom seems to be.
Tom started the show with his mother\'s favorite song.
We didn\'t have time to do everything we wanted to do.
What makes you think Tom wasn\'t the one who did that?
What\'s the most important lesson life has taught you?
I\'ve already told everybody about what we need to do.
Did you see the item in the paper about their wedding?
Almost every time I see Tom, he\'s wearing headphones.
I thought you said you didn\'t know anybody in Boston.
Tom and Mary would get together as much as they could.
The thought that Tom might be doing that worried Mary.
Tom wanted to go out with Mary even more than you did.
Tom wanted to know who Mary was going to do that with.
I think there\'s only a slim chance of that happening.
I don\'t know exactly what time Tom is going to leave.
Three months after Tom and Mary met, they got married.
Are you saying that you don\'t think that I can do it?
If you don\'t want us to get in Tom\'s way, we won\'t.
Do you think anyone would care if Tom didn\'t do that?
I figured it might be better if I didn\'t talk to Tom.
I couldn\'t think of any reason why Tom would be late.
Tom is enthusiastic about doing that, but Mary isn\'t.
The only reason I did that was because Tom told me to.
The party had no sooner started than it began to rain.
Tom won\'t believe Mary even if she swears it\'s true.
Tom and I weren\'t the ones who ate all the ice cream.
Tom and I will go together and we\'ll return together.
Tom isn\'t suggesting Mary could\'ve done that, is he?
Tom isn\'t very good at playing the devil\'s advocate.
I could tell right away that Tom wasn\'t feeling well.
I couldn\'t possibly go there unless you went with me.
I couldn\'t see myself ever doing something like that.
You shouldn\'t tell Tom that Mary is going to do that.
Tom and Mary decided to go out for a late-night snack.
We couldn\'t ask for a better French teacher than Tom.
We\'ll keep doing this until someone tells us to stop.
